ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: When I reminisce it is to teach younger family members what life was like when I was young and living in a different time.
When I reminisce it is to help me ''put my house in order'' before I die.
When I reminisce it is because it fills the gap when I find time ''heavy on my hands''
When I reminisce it is to help me plan for the future.
When I reminisce it is to keep alive the memory of a dead loved one.
When I reminisce it is because it brings me closer to newer friends and acquaintances.
When I reminisce it is because it promotes fellowship and a sense of belonging.
When I reminisce it is because it helps me contrast the ways I've changed with the ways I've stayed the same.
When I reminisce it is because it gives me a sense of personal completion or wholeness as I approach the end of life.
When I reminisce it is to see how my past fits in with my journey through life.
When I reminisce it is to pass the time during idle or restless hours.
When I reminisce it is to help solve some current difficulty.
When I reminisce it is to keep painful memories alive.
When I reminisce it is out of loyalty to keep alive the memory of someone close to me who has died.
When I reminisce it is to rehash lost opportunities.
When I reminisce it is to reduce boredom.
When I reminisce it is to remember an earlier time when I was treated unfairly by others.
When I reminisce it is to remind me that I have the skills to cope with present problems.
When I reminisce it is to relieve depression.
When I reminisce it is to transmit knowledge that I've acquired to someone else.
When I reminisce it is for lack of any better mental stimulation.
When I reminisce it is to create a common bond between old and new friends.
When I reminisce it is in order to teach younger persons about cultural values.
When I reminisce it is because it gives me a sense of self-identity.
When I reminisce it is to remember someone who has passed away.
When I reminisce it is because remembering my past helps me define who I am now.
When I reminisce it is as a way of bridging the ''generation gap''.
When I reminisce it is as a ''social lubricant'' to get people talking.
When I reminisce it is because it helps me prepare for my own death.
When I reminisce it is in order to leave a legacy of family history.
When I reminisce it is to put current problems in perspective.
When I reminisce it is to try to understand myself better.
When I reminisce it is because I feel less fearful of death after I finish reminiscing.
When I reminisce it is to create ease of conversation.
When I reminisce it is because it helps me see that I've lived a full life and can therefore accept death more calmly.
When I reminisce it is as a means of self-exploration and growth.
When I reminisce it is for something to do.
When I reminisce it is because it helps me cope with thoughts of my own mortality.
When I reminisce it is to see how my strengths can help me solve a current problem.
When I reminisce it is to rekindle bitter memories.
When I reminisce it is to remember people I was close to but who are no longer a part of my life.
When I reminisce it is to avoid repeating past mistakes at some later date.
When I reminisce it is to keep memories of old hurts fresh in my mind.
